comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0; GTB7.2; Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1) ; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.4506.2152; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; OfficeLiveConnector.1.5; OfficeLivePatch.1.3; InfoPath.2; .NET4.0C)

Steps to reproduce:

I am using version 3.5.63. I tried to upgrade to V5.0 then V7.0 .. each version then denies me access to sites I could previously access i.e banking sites which of course rebders the browser useless to me. Being stuck with 3.5.63 is a pain as its so slow to load and after about 30 mins if its left open on the screen appears to close and then I cannot re-open it because it says an incidence is already open yet I cannot find it even in task bar manager so its become a real pain in the ass to use. This error is non existent in IE7 or Chrome so your browser is becoming a major irritant to me. Kindly develop a new version where the defaults are exactly as they are in 3.5.63 because something changes in newer versions and I have neither the time or expertise to become your problem solver. 


Actual results:

Upgrading to any new version beyond 3.5.63 kills my ability to search for specific previously allowed legitimate sites like Westpac Bank and login - this is ridiculous and yet you say you will provide support for earlier versions - well thats just plain stupid if you cannot get to a newr version ! 


Expected results:

I should be able to run V7 EXACTLY the same way as it behaves in V3.5.63 non negotiable.
comments.creator: ramnet@tpg.com.au
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0; GTB7.2; Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1) ; .NET CLR 1.1.4322; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.0.4506.2152; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; OfficeLiveConnector.1.5; OfficeLivePatch.1.3; InfoPath.2; .NET4.0C)

comments.creator: gavin.sharp@gmail.com
comments.text:
Sorry you're having trouble with newer versions of Firefox. Often this is the result of the sites themselves detecting the new version and refusing to function, which isn't necessarily caused by a problem with Firefox, so it would help if you could be very specific about which sites are causing problems.

You mention "Westpac Bank", which I assume is the website at http://www.westpac.com.au/ . Do you need to be a customer to experience the problem? Are there other sites that are similarly affected?
comments.author: gavin.sharp@gmail.com
